claim: Google Shell Style Guide recommends 2-space indentation
shfmt with -i 2 -ci flags produces Google-style formatting
ShellCheck has 547+ documented warning codes organized by category
SC2086 is the most common ShellCheck warning about quoting
Google mandates bash-only for executable scripts with #!/bin/bash shebang
set -euo pipefail is the unofficial bash strict mode
Double quotes prevent word splitting and glob expansion
$() command substitution is POSIX-recommended over backticks
[[ is preferred over [ in bash for tests (Google + community consensus)
Function variables should use local keyword
lowercase_with_underscores for variables; UPPERCASE for constants/env
EditorConfig integrates with shfmt for project-wide settings
.shellcheckrc supports disable/enable/source-path directives
Greg's Wiki BashPitfalls documents 30+ common anti-patterns
main() function pattern recommended for larger scripts
checkbashisms tool tests POSIX compliance
shfmt + shellcheck can be integrated via GitHub Actions
pre-commit hooks available for both shfmt and shellcheck
Maximum line length of 80 characters is common standard
Heredocs support tab-stripping with <<- operator
Arrays should be quoted with "${array[@]}" syntax
